hypothesis: Charles Marie de La Condamine was born in the 1700's.
premise: + Charles Marie de La Condamine + Charles Marie de La Condamine ( 28 January 1701 - 13 February 1774 ) was a French explorer , geographer , and mathematician .
explanation_1: Charles Marie de La Condamine was born in the 1700's.

hypothesis: Chris Pratt starred in Jurassic World.
premise: + Chris Pratt + In 2015 , he starred in Jurassic World , the fourth installment in the Jurassic Park franchise and his most financially successful film to date , earning $ 1.6 billion at the box office . + Jurassic World + Jurassic World is a 2015 American science-fiction adventure film and the fourth installment of the Jurassic Park series . + Jurassic World + The film was directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow , produced by Frank Marshall and Patrick Crowley , and stars Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard . + Chris Pratt + Christopher Michael Pratt ( born June 21 , 1979 ) is an American actor .
explanation_1: Chris Pratt starred in Jurassic World, which was directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow, produced by Frank Marshall and Patrick Crowley, and stars Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard.

premise: + Machu Picchu + Machu Picchu  ( Machu Pikchu  ) is a 15th-century Inca citadel situated on a mountain ridge 2430 m above sea level .
explanation_1: Machu Picchu is a citadel, however it is not the only one.

hypothesis: Machu Picchu was located in the Americas.
premise: + Machu Picchu + Machu Picchu  ( Machu Pikchu  ) is a 15th-century Inca citadel situated on a mountain ridge 2430 m above sea level . + Machu Picchu + It is located in the Cusco Region , Urubamba Province , Machupicchu District in Peru , above the Sacred Valley , which is 80 km northwest of Cuzco and through which the Urubamba River flows . + Peru + Peru , is a country in western South America . + Inca Empire + The Inca Empire ( Quechua : Tawantinsuyu , `` The Four Regions '' ) , also known as the Incan Empire and the Inka Empire , was the largest empire in pre-Columbian America , and possibly the largest empire in the world in the early 16th century . + Sacred Valley + The Sacred Valley of the Incas ( Valle Sagrado de los Incas Willka Qhichwa ) or the Urubamba Valley is a valley in the Andes of Peru , 20 km at its closest north of the Inca capital of Cusco .
explanation_1: Machu Picchu is located in Peru, which is in the Americas.

hypothesis: Warren Buffett works for a business magnate.
premise: + Warren Buffett + Warren Edward Buffett (  born August 30 , 1930 ) is an American business magnate , investor , and philanthropist .
explanation_1: Warren Buffett is a business magnate.

premise: + Robert Wagner + Wagner 's autobiography , Pieces of My Heart : A Life , written with author Scott Eyman , was published on September 23 , 2008 . + The Pink Panther (1963 film) + The Pink Panther is a 1963 American comedy film directed by Blake Edwards and co-written by Edwards and Maurice Richlin , starring David Niven , Peter Sellers , Robert Wagner , Capucine , and Claudia Cardinale . + Robert Wagner + In movies , Wagner is known for his role as Number Two in the Austin Powers trilogy of films ( 1997 , 1999 , 2002 ) , as well as for A Kiss Before Dying , The Pink Panther , Harper , The Towering Inferno and many more . + A Kiss Before Dying (1956 film) + The screenplay was written by Lawrence Roman , based on Ira Levin 's 1953 novel of the same name , which won the 1954 Edgar Award for `` Best First Novel . ''
explanation_1: Robert Wagner has written an autobiography, Pieces of My Heart: A Life, which was published on September 23, 2008.

hypothesis: Celine Dion signed with one of Marvel's acting studios.
premise: + Epic Records + Epic Records is an American record label owned by Sony Music Entertainment , a subsidiary of Sony Corporation of America , Inc. . + Celine Dion + Following a series of French albums during the 1980s , she signed on to Epic Records in the United States .
explanation_1: Celine Dion signed with Epic Records, not with one of Marvel's acting studios.

hypothesis: Julius Caesar was released in the 1950s.
premise: + Julius Caesar (1953 film) + Julius Caesar is a 1953 epic Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer film adaptation of the play by Shakespeare , directed by Joseph L. Mankiewicz , who also wrote the uncredited screenplay , and produced by John Houseman . + Julius Caesar (1970 film) + Julius Caesar is a 1970 British independent film adaptation of William Shakespeare 's play of the same name , directed by Stuart Burge from a screenplay by Robert Furnival .
explanation_1: Julius Caesar was released in 1953 and 1970.

premise: + Brave (2012 film) + Brave is a 2012 American 3D computer-animated fantasy comedy-drama film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures . + Kelly Macdonald + Kelly Macdonald ( born 23 February 1976 ) is a Scottish actress , known for her roles in the films Trainspotting ( 1996 ) , Gosford Park ( 2001 ) , Intermission ( 2003 ) , Nanny McPhee ( 2005 ) , Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2 ( 2011 ) and Brave ( 2012 ) . + Brave (2012 film) + Brave premiered on June 10 , 2012 , at the Seattle International Film Festival , and was released in North America on June 22 , 2012 , to both positive reviews and box office success . + 3D film + A three-dimensional stereoscopic film ( also known as three-dimensional film , 3D film or S3D film ) is a motion picture that enhances the illusion of depth perception , hence adding a third dimension . + Seattle International Film Festival + The Seattle International Film Festival ( SIFF ) , held annually in Seattle , Washington since 1976 , is among the top film festivals in North America .
explanation_1: Brave is a 2012 film, not a television series.

premise: + Imagine Dragons + Imagine Dragons is an American rock band from Las Vegas , Nevada , consisting of lead vocalist Dan Reynolds , lead guitarist Wayne Sermon , bassist Ben McKee , and drummer Daniel Platzman . + Nevada + Nevada ( Spanish for `` snowy '' ; see pronunciations ) is a state in the Western , Mountain West , and Southwestern regions of the United States of America .
explanation_1: Imagine Dragons is from Las Vegas, Nevada.

premise: + Ayn Rand + In politics , she condemned the initiation of force as immoral , and opposed collectivism and statism as well as anarchism , and instead supported laissez-faire capitalism , which she defined as the system based on recognizing individual rights . + Conservatism in the United States + American Conservatism is a broad system of political beliefs in the United States that is characterized by respect for American traditions , support for Judeo-Christian values , economic liberalism , anti-communism , advocacy of American exceptionalism , and a defense of Western culture from threats posed by `` creeping socialism '' , moral relativism , multiculturalism and liberal internationalism . + Ayn Rand + She is known for her two best-selling novels , The Fountainhead and Atlas Shrugged , and for developing a philosophical system she called Objectivism . + Ayn Rand + She has been a significant influence among libertarians and American conservatives . + Ayn Rand + She supported rational and ethical egoism , and rejected altruism .
explanation_1: Ayn Rand was a supporter of laissez-faire capitalism, which she defined as the system based on recognizing individual rights. She was not a supporter of collectivism.

hypothesis: The United States Environmental Protection Agency has a staff that mainly consists of programmers, biologists, and teachers.
premise: + United States Environmental Protection Agency + More than half of EPA 's employees are engineers , scientists , and environmental protection specialists ; other employees include legal , public affairs , financial , and information technologists .
explanation_1: The United States Environmental Protection Agency has a staff that mainly consists of engineers, scientists, and environmental protection specialists.
